Package edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.ui

Interface UserInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GUI, TextUserInterface
    public interface UserInterface
    The UserInterface is an interface that will be implemented by every class that will directly interact with the player. It contains all the methods that are needed and that will be used. Because the GameEngine specifies this type rather than a specific type of UserInterface, the only methods it will be allowed to use are in here. Therefore everything useful must be in here, and anything outside of it will not be able to be called directly from the game engine.

      This method will display the exit options that will allow the player to either save the game or exit.

      This method displays the prompts that will give the player three options of starting a game, loading a game, or exiting the game.

    • Method Detail

      • instruction

        void instruction()
        This method will display how to play the game to the user. The field will explain to the user what keys to use to play the game, what the powerups do, and the end objective to find the hidden briefcase through describing the setting.

      • gameStartPrompt

        int gameStartPrompt()
        This method displays the prompts that will give the player three options of starting a game, loading a game, or exiting the game.
        Returns:
        the int value representing the player's choice

      • playerOptions

        int playerOptions​(boolean looking)
        This method prints out the player's options of looking, shooting, and debugging. These options will be displayed
        Parameters:
        looking - whether the player is looking on this turn, true for yes, false for no
        Returns:
        the int value representing the player's choice

      • direction

        int direction()
        This method handles directions, which is used in the movement option and the look option. The user will press the corresponding number (1,2,3,4) to specify direction.
        Returns:
        the direction specified by the player. 1 for up, 2 for down, 3 for left, 4 for right

      • exitOptions

        int exitOptions()
        This method will display the exit options that will allow the player to either save the game or exit. These options will be available to the player throughout the game.
        Returns:
        the int value representing the player's choice

      • hardAI

        int hardAI()
        This method is called in the beginning of the game right after the GameEngine.run(boolean) is called. It allows the player to choose which mode the player wishes to play in. When returning hard mode, it will call a method which moves the ninjas differently compared to easy mode.
        Returns:
        the int value that represents the player's choice. 1 for easy, 2 for hard

      • takeInput

        int takeInput​(int lowBound,
              int highBound)
        This method will take input from the player. It will ask the player to enter their input for a specified prompt, and will keep running until a valid answer is provided.
        Parameters:
        lowBound - the lowest number the player can pick
        highBound - the highest number the player can pick
        Returns:
        the int value of the player's choice

      • printGrid

        void printGrid​(Grid grid,
               Player player,
               Invincibility shield,
               boolean hardMode)
        This method prints the grid, which serves as the base view of the game. The player must navigate through the grid in order to play.
        Parameters:
        grid - the Grid object
        player - the Player object
        shield - the Invincibility object
        hardMode - whether or not the game is in hard mode. true for hard mode, false for easy mode

      • errorCheck

        void errorCheck​(boolean room)
        This method displays an error message when the user attempts to move in directions that are outside the grid space, or when the player tries to move into a room from the wrong direction
        Parameters:
        room - whether or not the movement is into a room.

      • noCase

        void noCase()
        This method displays a message letting the player know that the player has looked into the empty room and used up their turn. The purpose of this method is to notify the player that there is nothing in the room and the turn has been used up.

      • endMessage

        void endMessage​(boolean win)
        This method notifies the player if the character has found the briefcase or has died, and prints a corresponding message.
        Parameters:
        win - whether or not the player has won

      • loseLife

        void loseLife()
        The method notifies the player when they are stabbed by a ninja. The system will tell the character that they have lost a life and have respawned to their initial placement on the grid.

      • killedNinja

        void killedNinja()
        This method will display a kill message to the user when the user shoots the bullet and kills the ninja. This method will be called from the Game Engine

      • noBullet

        void noBullet()
        This method is called whenever the player tries to shoot and has no bullets. It will display a message telling the player to try again; which means the player cannot fire and is required to do something else.

      • noSaveFile

        void noSaveFile()
        This method prompts the user with the information that they have not saved any file, and there can therefore be nothing to load from
